file_content.text: You escaped, excellent. Subject 13's ancient cell remains a mystery to us, but I apologize for keeping you in the dark this long.
At any rate, Subject 13 has assumed control of my apprentice. The shock collar cured the prisoner's initial disobedience.
Soon I will direct his wrath against the Republic. The chaos he unleashes shall be in your name.
[You activate the monitoring station terminal and set it to the Imperial frequency.]
Finally, someone's penetrated the deep tombs. And a Sith, nonetheless. We're both busy, so I'll be brief.
Agent. Wonderful. Commander Calum assured me you would penetrate the deep tombs. I will keep this brief.
Hunter. Commander Calum was right to put his faith in you. If you don't mind, I'll be blunt.
You've done well to penetrate the tomb. My slaves' expedition failed, but perhaps you could help me.
There is a prisoner in your area. Immensely powerful, hardened by decades of experimentations and then left to rot.
He is known only as "Subject 13." He must be freed and made to serve the Empire.
Another vengeful ally. Good.
I knew you'd understand. There are cowards who would as soon leave his power untapped.
Extraction demands a strategy.
Prison break. Got it.
This is Belsavis. I'm afraid nothing is that easy.
You're sure Subject 13 exists?
Intelligence conducted a thorough analysis of the prison records. There is no doubt.
He might turn on us.
Power demands risk. Surely you aren't averse to a little danger.
Whoever or whatever Subject 13 is, he won't bow to the Empire without some... convincing.
Any Sith could break his shackles, but you alone possess the strength to dominate Subject 13.
And who better than a member of Intelligence to bend Subject 13 to our will?
Free Subject 13, break him and the Empire will repay your loyal service.
Then we have a deal.
I can't wait.
You've displayed your potential by probing Belsavis's unexplored depths. Now prove yourself by freeing Subject 13 and bending him to the Empire's will.
Subject 13 will soon serve us.
Consider this prisoner freed.
I can't wait.
Excellent.
How much is his freedom worth?
Your loyalty will be repaid, hunter. Have no doubt.
Follow the coordinates to Subject 13's cell. Subdue him, then my apprentice will facilitate his escape.
I will await word of the prisoner's liberation.
I really can't. [Refuse quest]
Useless.
[This monitoring station appears to be deactivated.]
